description: The function 'draw_cross_section_question' generates 2D images of cross-sections of 3D shapes. It is designed to help students visualize and understand the concept of cross-sections in geometry. The function can generate cross-sections of a variety of 3D shapes, including spheres, cylinders, cones, rectangular prisms, cubes, and pyramids.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Cross-Sections of 3D Shapes
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'draw_cross_section_question' function can generate cross-sections of six different 3D shapes: spheres, cylinders, cones, rectangular prisms, cubes, and pyramids. The cross-sections can be either horizontal or vertical, depending on the shape and the desired cross-section. The function accepts a 'CrossSectionQuestion' object as input, which contains the shape and the correct cross-section. The shape is defined by its type and dimensions (e.g., radius for a sphere, height and base for a cone). The function validates the input and determines the orientation of the cross-section based on a predefined map of valid combinations. The function is used in geometry education to help students visualize and understand cross-sections.

details: The function accepts a 'CrossSectionQuestion' object as input.
The 'CrossSectionQuestion' object contains the shape and the correct cross-section.
The shape is defined by its type (e.g., 'sphere', 'cylinder', 'cone', 'rectangular prism', 'cube', 'pyramid') and dimensions (e.g., radius for a sphere, height and base for a cone).
The correct cross-section is a string that specifies the desired cross-section (e.g., 'circle', 'rectangle', 'triangle', 'square').
The shape type and the correct cross-section must be valid and form a valid combination (e.g., a sphere can only have a circle cross-section, a cylinder can have a circle or rectangle cross-section).
The dimensions of the shape must be positive numbers.
The function validates the input and throws an error if the input is not valid.
The function generates a 2D image of the cross-section of the specified 3D shape.
The orientation of the cross-section (horizontal or vertical) is determined by the shape and the desired cross-section.
The size and shape of the cross-section depend on the dimensions of the 3D shape.
